m_szDocTitle: GM Sees No Auto Slowdown, Plans To Cut Incentives In Q1 | Stock News & Stock Market Analysis - IBD
m_szDocSumamry: Reprints General Motors ( GM ) dismissed concerns that car demand has peaked after record sales last year and will cut vehicle incentives this quarter on expectations of a strong U.S. market. GM CFO Chuck Stevens told analysts on a call that a cyclical downturn in the auto sector isn't expected in the next several years, but added that the auto giant is prepared if demand dips in the short term. CEO Mary Barra said U.S. car demand should "plateau" in a few years, but not slide down from a peak.
